website_summaries.verdict: While is has a lot to offer in the way of safety and entertainment, some of its features are awkward and could be more functional.
pros: Has an impressive play station that's removable and includes lights, sounds, and fun characters
cons: Seat adjustments are difficult to change, and the height range is often too high or too low

customer_reviews.title: Defective product! But good Amazon service.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Cheap looking and flimsy walker. Product came in defective the walker leg was broken. Called Amazon since the box was damaged and was unable to close it. Amazon was able to refund me the money and was asked to dispose the product.
customer_reviews.author: neet chadha

customer_reviews.title: Good product 2 in 1 play item
customer_reviews.text: Worthy product, I bought when my baby is 8 months, used for few months. Pros : Easy to fit Easy to clean sitting cushion as a detachable one so that you can put in washer as well wheels are of good quality , never had any issue while my baby was using this. Music and steering is big plus so that even now when he is 2 ys he still uses the handle one to play. hence its 2 in 1 (long lasting one ) These wheels works only for flat floor ( Not on CARPET )
customer_reviews.author: Shuba

customer_reviews.title: Baby's favorite
customer_reviews.text: I thought my baby might get bored with this as there aren't many accessories but he loves it. He enjoys playing with the frog, mostly I think he enjoys standing without someone holding him. I have been letting him play in it since he was five months. Some days he is grouchy until I put him in his little walker. I even feed him in it because we are just starting out so I want him to be comfortable. And on top of that it is super easy to assemble and I know my baby is safe in it (although he is always supervised).
customer_reviews.author: Jumping Beans

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and versitile walker!
customer_reviews.text: For those of us who have very little ones who have that drive to be vertical this is a life-saver! We've had more than one three or four month old baby who just seems to need to be able to stand and balance "on their own" and this is a very sturdy walker that safely allows that activity. The seat supports without constricting legs and the tray has the ability to hook toys to it so it also provides for grabbing coordination. Just follow the guidelines for advisable time to spend so the little ones get their tummy time, too!
customer_reviews.author: mackenzee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Walk About Walker
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th Walk About Walker I have bought as baby shower gifts. All the girls love them. They put their babies in them at an early age after they have learned head control. They love the items they can play with. I also bought extra items and rings so they can attach them to the unused loops or they can remove one toy and replace it with another. It helps develop the baby leg muscles for walking later. It is easy to wipe out if it gets dirty. My girlfriend took her baby outside on a blanket and put her in this while she worked in the yard. Very sturdy and easy to put together. Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Grandma Likes It So It Must Be Good
customer_reviews.text: I needed a walker for grandbabies so that moms and dads could sit down to eat without a child on their laps. This is only used a few times a year when we have family gatherings, but it has so far been the "throne" of many babies. The price was right for me, it's easy to clean (I hose it down on the deck), and the little ones seem to be entertained by the "toys" long enough. Walkers have come a long ways since my kids were tiny, but I'm glad I could find one that had a reasonable price tag and got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Perez

customer_reviews.title: Needs padding
customer_reviews.text: I really like this walker. My daughter loves the little toys and music it plays. You can also remove the toys so that we can set her little snacks on there. One thing I don’t like however is there is absolutely no padding around the seat where the babys belly and back are. So when we first put her in there and she was still a little wobbly she would kind of slam herself back and hurt her little back or lean forward to fast and hurt her little belly. All I did was stuff a receiving blanket underneath in between the fabric and the seat back and put a blanket around her.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves
customer_reviews.text: So this was on sale for $29.99 . It is a great little walker. My biggest complaint is the toy that removes from tray. It is cheap and basically does nothing. I bought a suction cup activity toy to put in its place. I wish they had more of those clips you can put on there to hold toys. Otherwise, my granddaughter, 7 months, is all over on it. It does stop her from going over the threshold which is a good thing for now. I don’t have stairs in my home so no supper worries. I have not tried to fold or do any major cleaning...only reason I gave low stars there, I truly don’t know
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected!!! 😤
customer_reviews.text: My child can move around the house with this BUT, The supid toy is useless they dont even move my 6 month old trys so hard to play with these but just ends up frustrated! Not what I wanted or expected!!!!!!! You can remove they toy buy its not safe tiny fingers will get stuck in the holes where they toy latches. Also tried putting batteries on this crap and I could never unscrew it. I tried like no lie 6 different screw drivers. This will definitely last a long time since my child wont use as much 😒
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Useless “toy station”
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice walker. However, the toy station that comes with it is difficult for my 6 month old to play with. The wheel is hard to turn and the animal that you can slide on it is hard to move. He also doesn’t know to press the “horn” yet so he’s just sitting in it and walking around. He can’t play with the toy station so it’s basically useless for him. We had to buy separate toys to attach to it. Maybe it’s better for an older child?
customer_reviews.author: S.F. Hirmiz

customer_reviews.title: Tall Baby? Buy Something Else.
customer_reviews.text: This walker is super cute! Unfortunately, it was far too low for our six-month-old. Yes, he's a tall baby (in the 90th percentile), but it seems like a pretty big oversite on Bright Starts part to have a six-month-old who has just learned to sit up on his own to actually be too tall for a walker even on its tallest setting. If you have a midget-baby, this will last you a while. But if your baby grows as it should, this walker won't last you very long. Baby will outgrow it fast!
customer_reviews.author: Creepstar

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a five star but since I live in a one bedroom I need all the space I can get. The fact that it can fold down is nice problem is you can’t fit it under couches or beds because the chair is way to high. Therefore I still have it out. Annoying. But overall is a good cheap walker. Will recommend. Oh and the closing is a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Chanel

customer_reviews.title: The back part is quite hard though and baby can easily hit the back of her head on it
customer_reviews.text: Baby likes to sit/stand in this with the aid of a pillow. She is 5 months and isn't sitting up yet but still is able to use this toy. She is about 25in tall right now. The back part is quite hard though and baby can easily hit the back of her head on it. Also the product can be a little tricky to fold flat and it does not lock in place when flat. Other than those concerns it is a good product and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Ann

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: Okay for what you pay for. I was under the impression it would adjust a lot more than it did. My son can’t use it because it has minimal three adjustments. There’s a lot of room for it to adjust, but there are only three clicks for the adjustments so he’s not tall enough. If I hold it up for him he can use it, but it doesn’t click into place. Also does not do well on rough surfaces at all. Wheels are really touchy. And the toys on the front aren’t the greatest. But ur not paying for the best I guess...
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Let your kid explore!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves being able to wander around on her own in the walker. It's a very basic walker - a few things on it to keep her entertained - but that's all I really expected anyway! I would just recommend you keep an eye on your kid at all times while playing in the walker. (I had a vase on my coffee table, and she was reaching for the flowers... had I not been watching her she could've pulled some flowers and potentially had the vase fall!)
customer_reviews.author: comp_g33k

customer_reviews.title: All we need
customer_reviews.text: Cute and is very easy to put together. My 10 month old baby is really fascinating by the toy station. The package arrived a day late, but it was no big deal. The base of the walker has some defect, but it is not a real issue to us. The price is cheaper than buying directly from Babies R Us. I would recommend this product to any new parents.
customer_reviews.author: Kepaco

customer_reviews.title: Good walker
customer_reviews.text: I got this when baby was just past 6 months, standing in her own and walking with help. Even though pediatrician a do not recommend this as it can delay walking, we only out her in it for last than 30 minutes a day. It took a while for her to learn to walk with it successfully and it has a bigger foot print than I imagined. It's nice that it folds up to transport or simply put away. I actually wish she liked it more (she seems to last about 5 minutes in it before wanting to get out) and some of the noises are really annoyingly loud, but it's inexpensive, safe and does what it's supposed to!
customer_reviews.author: corky4

customer_reviews.title: Worst Walker
customer_reviews.text: Baby cannot reach the floor in the lowest setting whereas, in her old walker she could reach the floor and move around the house efficiently. Even if she could reach the floor, the wheels on this walker get stuck frequently and make a horrible scraping sound on the wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: christyle

customer_reviews.title: Not very entertaining.
customer_reviews.text: As one of the reviewers said, the green semi pointy object on the side is useless and it can hurt the baby. My baby loves to smack his hands down on the table so with those on there it's just too dangerous, so I left them out. The green ring with the tiger is useless also. The whole table offers not much activities and not interested. My baby only likes the steering wheel and the only way it makes sound is the button in the middle of the steering wheel. Again, my baby isn't interested. It works on carpet if you unscrew the rubber guards on the bottom. On the plus side, I love that it collapse and store away.
customer_reviews.author: Infamous K

customer_reviews.title: Good walker for price.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I’m giving this a 1 is because it seemed like it had more to it in the pictures in discription. It only makes noise on the wheel when the button is pushed. The wheel is also a little hard to turn so my lo can’t do that yet but it does move easily. Kinda wish it did a little more toy wise.
customer_reviews.author: DRaft

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Price reflects quality. Does not glide on hardwoods well. Also does not turn well. Instructions were only pictures with no writing. Can be figured out but overall play the little extra money for a decent walker
customer_reviews.author: jacjac23

customer_reviews.title: Keep an eye on the seat fasteners
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised, but the bumpers underneath aren't removable as I had thought to allow for use on our shag carpeting. Also, the clips that fasten the cloth seat into the frame keep popping out (our 9 month old is really active & bouncy), so that's a little concerning. Don't use nearly as much as we had anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Van

customer_reviews.title: This walker is super cute and great for the price compared to others ...
customer_reviews.text: This walker is super cute and great for the price compared to others at comparable places like walmart/ target. The only complaint I have is that my LO is used to the excersaucer and bouncy times so she still jumps around, and the two little pink flowers seem to come down right where her arms are so shes hurt herself a couple times. Easy fix, we just took those off, but I would recommend not installing them at all until your LO stops jumping/ lunging forward in it (if that ever happens?? :)) Easy set up and light weight!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is trying her hardest to walk and skip the crawling stage. Well, she loves it! Which I’m glad. The only issues I have is the seat back has no cushioning what so ever and is a bit too short. It heads my daughter right at the base of the head. Also, the steering wheel could be softer. I get everything is made of plastic for easy cleaning but it hurts when you hit it. Like my daughter has done a few times with her head. Basically the whole thing needs more padding.
customer_reviews.author: paradise80

customer_reviews.title: and one didn't line up with any of the holes like the others
customer_reviews.text: I didn't see anywhere that there was a 26 lb weight limit until I read the first 3 safety check items in the instruction manual, also the cloth seat that has the lock tabs that go into the plastic red piece were missing a few key tabs. Instructions indicated that there were 8 that needed locked in from the cloth seat cover to the plastic red part. There were only 6 tabs on my cloth seat, and one didn't line up with any of the holes like the others. I think it was a design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Doolittle

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, well engineered
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, well engineered. My issue is that it’s hard to turn the wheels on hardwood. So baby will be stuck going in a straight line most of the time to the point that an adult has to intervene to pick up the walker and turn it. Also top tray area is too small. Update: as baby gets stronger and older, they’ll be able to steer it around and turn as they should. Top area is still small, but baby will use the sode tray handles as a steering wheel to slide the walker around. Bumped up to 5 stars from 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RAG

customer_reviews.title: My son is tall and it was too short for ...
customer_reviews.text: My son is tall and it was too short for him. It didn't maneuver well, he had to push hard to get it to where he wanted it to go.
customer_reviews.author: DMoore

customer_reviews.title: Smaller babies may not be able to touch the floor
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute little walker that is reasonable in price and easy to assemble. The problem we have with it is that it doesn’t have a setting low enough to the floor to accommodate our grandson, who is definitely ready for a walker.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie's Themes

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this walker, it’s cute and can be adjusted for height.. adjusting it is a little hard to do.. and cleaning is difficult.. the little toys snap in and it’s pretty difficult to get them out. Two I haven’t figured out how to get out. Side note, our little runs our toes over with it and it does hurt, like there is something under neath and scraps our toes, not hers.
customer_reviews.author: Mikala Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Not horrible but not great
customer_reviews.text: It's doesn't move very easily with only the front wheels rotating. Doesnt lock into place when collapsed for storage. Also it's still too tall for my daughter. Who's a very tall girl. Maybe she'll be able to use it in a month or two. It's a lot cheaper made than I had expected. Only one actual toy attached.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun and very nice
customer_reviews.text: We made this purchase for our newest great and it is proving most successful. He enjoys it thoroughly and finds a lot of interesting things to do while he is occupying it. He is able to be much more mobile and that thrills him. It is a nicely made and sturdy walker with a lot of bright color to it. We like the activities that he can play with as he moves around the room. We did some research before we purchased this walker and are most pleased with our purchase. I do recommend this walker to anyone who is looking for one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Great Walker!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son when he was about seven and a half months old. Very colorful and keeps my son's attention. Plays music and it does have a volume level button. Works well on laminate floors, only works on carpet if you take off the black stoppers on the button (which is very easy, they just unscrew). The main white portion that plays music and has the steering wheel also comes off of the walker easily and he can play with it on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wicks

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: This product is not very good. The wheel and little bug are hard to move and make obnoxious clicking noises when they do move. Very disappointed in this product!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this walker. My son who is 5 months old loves it. It was super easy to assemble. The only downfall is that the seat cushion doesn't have a way of locking in so when I take my son out, it often takes the seat cushion out also. Overall super happy and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend a different walker for taller infants
customer_reviews.text: We really liked this walker but it is a pain at times to adjust the height. Our son also out grew this walker very quickly. He is on the bigger side so, can’t really I guess blame the company or anything, but it would’ve been nice if the tallest height was a bit higher than what they have for it.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Overall functional.
customer_reviews.text: This walker serves it purpose. We added felt bumpers to the sides to protect our trim since our child is a bit wild. The toys on top were not impressive and got in the way of his view so we removed them and now it’s an empty tray which is better.
customer_reviews.author: Corina_cmr

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my granddaughter and it is fantastic. It arrived quickly and is exactly as described and pictured. It is made very well and it is also very sturdy. She didn't need to use it very long but it was great while she used it. I would definitely order from this seller again,
customer_reviews.author: CUnkel

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!! Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: My baby had no problem with this walker. It adjusted to her growth well and it helped her strengthen her legs for walking. She used it to jump her legs a lot!! Ultimately she was walking by 9 months and I’m sure The walker helped. The colors are pretty and she liked playing with the music. Also Easy to take apart and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Karame_Kurls

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WALKER GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Great walker so glad i didn't spend more than needed on some other walker. This one definitely does the job my little girl loves it. Has awesome safety guards to ensure she doesn't go down any slopes and such. This is the go to walker for any mom or dad that has a little one they want to keep safe and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Elizabeth Thacker

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a secondary walker for my grandson so the kids didn't have to haul a bunch of stuff back and forth so I didn't want to spend a fortune on it. Pros: 1) It does the job 2) It does fold Flat 3) Has 3 heights Cons: 1) Toys are minimal... 2) Toy tray is hard to get off... 3) Rubber stoppers on bottom? They make it impossible to go across carpet (but they can be removed with a Philips screwdriver - 16 little screws later)
customer_reviews.author: LMB

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while ago for my grandson. His legs weren't long enough when he needed it, and when they were, he was already into beginning to walk. I think for the price it was definitely worth it, but unfortunately, it wasn't used as much as we thought it would be. Hopefully, it can be passed on to the next grandchild that might come along!
customer_reviews.author: Judy T

customer_reviews.title: Basic but does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: The back rest is a little hard for baby and the monkey doesn’t really look like a monkey. The ears should have been on the outside of the fabric. It also doesn’t come with 2 toys for the baby to play with. I had to buy rings and attach my own 2 toys. I do like that it is adjustable for 2 heights.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Do not recoment
customer_reviews.text: This walker was great for the first month but after that the wheels caught anything that was on the floor it caught so much hair around the wheels which made the wheels impossible to move and it was completely impossible to get the hairs out we have tried everything so my baby can no longer use it and the wheel broke off as well
customer_reviews.author: Alondra

customer_reviews.title: Cute walker
customer_reviews.text: Super cute walker. The moveable parts are hard to move, even as an adult. And it definitely doesn’t work in any type of carpet whatsoever. And be carful for your ankles when your child comes charging at you in it. Like getting hit in the ankle with a shopping cart. Ouch. Just little things about this walker make it lose a star in my opinion. My 8 month old sees nothing wrong with it though
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves it! The walker is just as expected. The box was damaged with a hole in it and thankfully it didn’t damaged the walker. I’m giving it 4 stars because of those hard flower things attached to it. My baby has hit her head on it a few times. She be used for something else like more toys to grab on or more activities to help with motor functions.
customer_reviews.author: Magzster

customer_reviews.title: seems to love it now as she's exploring and learning how to ...
customer_reviews.text: Rough intro at first, baby was put off by the toy for some reason, seems to love it now as she's exploring and learning how to use the toy. Toy can be removed, but it seems difficult, may be user error on my part though. The top of the seat is not as cushioned as I'd hoped it would be for those times when baby throws her head back during a tantrum. Be aware steering wheel toy is positioned very close to baby's face. Rolls well enough on both carpet and floor, may find at some points the wheels only turn certain directions, surely by design. Good, basic walker, fulfills its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Lopez

customer_reviews.title: This is the walker to get. Your baby will love it
customer_reviews.text: This turned out even better than expected. I researched several brands before buying. This is well worth the price, super cute and easy to assemble. My 8 month old loves it she will be scooting all around in no time. We just got it and she is learning to push backwards right away. She seems very comfortable in it. Great choice for a baby walker. I’m very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nannerz

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheaper walker. I get that. However the wheels are very small. We have hardwood floors and they still don't like to move on the floor easy. However, my daughter seems to like the toy. Makes it hard to clean under. Still satisfied but wouldn't recommend b/c of the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: ajulie4u

customer_reviews.title: Very nice walker....
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice... kinda tough to break down to store away but fits the bill for babysitting my great nephew.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Jo

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and safe
customer_reviews.text: This walker is super cute and colorful, my daughter took an immediate liking to it. She's a bit too small to reach the ground even on the lowest setting (at almost 4 months) but she likes sitting in it anyway. I've read that there seems to be a lot of concern about the "sharp" leaves on the sides of the tray. However, they don't seem sharp to me at all and I don't see how they could be dangerous. I'm giving it 4 stars because I was expecting it to have more features for my kid to play with. And the steering wheel doesn't turn, which in my opinion is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: wedgita

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!
customer_reviews.text: Took me a few minutes to figure out how to adjust the seat on this Walker. Once we figured that out, since the directions are not very clear, our granddaughter loves it. She can reach the floor and loves the music it plays.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Delong

customer_reviews.title: This isn't a high quality walker but if you want ...
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a high quality walker but if you want something simple that folds down, it's okay. Baby likes it, of course I'm always supervising her in it and I don't leave her in very long but she enjoys it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky GV

customer_reviews.title: It's great for a first walker
customer_reviews.text: My little girl loves her walker. She's just now learning to scoot around. The only complaint I have about this product is I know once she starts really moving around in it, she might get a little frustrated. The back wheels don't turn, they just go forward/backward so I can see it getting stuck but other than that it's made well and worth the money. It's great for a first walker.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Harris

customer_reviews.title: Cute, light weight!
customer_reviews.text: This walker is very cute and gender nuetral. The rubber pads on bottom are great, so not to scuff hardwood floors. It's pretty light weight and actually like that the latch underneath is not easy to undo for collapsing; definitely wouldn't collapse with little one in it. The seat is easy to remove for washing. Just have to be sure not to forget to remove the toy section on tray to clean underneath... often. Drinks and food that spill or get spit-up get in the cracks and get nasty!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Onken

customer_reviews.title: Good walker, but sharp place somewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Been using for a few months now! Just put up for the next baby. Good walker. My only complaint is my LO has gotten cuts on her fingers twice while in this walker. We can’t find a sharp place on it, but its odd that she was in the walker both times it has happen. She didn’t cry either time, she just starts bleeding like crazy and cuts on her fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Burger

customer_reviews.title: I love this walker
customer_reviews.text: I love this walker! We had another walker that was more of a seat and less of a walker. This is perfect. It allows my son the freedom he is looking for at 6 months but the safety for his Dad and I. He is able to sit when he wants rest and walk around when he has energy. He moves all over the house and loves to explore.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: height adjutment
customer_reviews.text: i love it and the price is good wish it went a little more to the flor, my grandson is 2 months but already wanting to stand but the walker only goes down to a ertain height but its ok a couple more weeks he will be able to touch the floor. but i still love the walker
customer_reviews.author: Verrn

customer_reviews.title: Decent price, nothing fancy
customer_reviews.text: Our son is just under 50th percentile on height, and he is already too tall for the highest setting at 10 months old. His feet are flat on the floor and knees even bent somewhat. The steering wheel made clicking sounds at first, but after a day or two, it stopped. The tiger barely moves at all. The rings do spin, but they don't move much. The button in the middle of the steering wheel presses and plays a couple of short tunes. The seat seems thin and kind of flimsy, but for $40.....it's average.
customer_reviews.author: Mollz

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. My two yr old loves to press the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 7 month old son who is now 8 months. He loves to be lift up and hates to be by himself. This walker entertains him for a couple of minutes and allows him to follow me. I can remove the steering wheel and place treats for him to eat. I chose this walker because he is tall (78 cm length) and did not want him to out grow it before he can walk on his own. This one seemed taller than the others. So far so good. My two yr old loves to press the horn and even tries to go i it (so at least I know its sturdy and strong).
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: great walker!
customer_reviews.text: Cute walker! we have a single step at home to our living room and this ismade safe to prevent her from the walker from going over the step and falling forward. my daughter loves!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry804

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it, she's just too short.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 5mo old. She loves sitting in it... But even on the lowest setting, her feet don't touch the ground. She is on the shorter side (25% percentile) so I am hoping she grows into it soon. Aside from that, I LOVE that it collapses down small enough to slide under the couch to store. Our house has overfilled with baby stuff recently, and it's nice to have something that can easily be tucked out of sight. Only deducted a star because I wish it had one more low height setting. The track is long enough it could easily be added.
customer_reviews.author: Stay@Home Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great product well made
customer_reviews.text: Daughter used this a ton. Sturdy AF didn’t have any issues closing it or opening it ever. Cleaning was easy as well. My daughter is also quite rambunctious and wild, so if it contained her that’s pretty solid she’s in the 100 percentile for height and weight so I’m sure your baby is fine. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Ill Will

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and my daughter loves it! She's comfortable and able to move around smoothly. She recently started sitting on her own, but now wants to stand constantly. This allows her to practice standing without me having to hold her up for those moments when I need to get something done.
customer_reviews.author: Karianne Haga

customer_reviews.title: Keeps baby happy
customer_reviews.text: My 9-month-old loves cruising around in this thing! We have wood floors and it works perfectly. She does not have any trouble going in any direction. She loves standing and walking but can't do either independently so this toy is great at keeping her happy!
customer_reviews.author: M. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect walker
customer_reviews.text: Love this walker. I wish the toys on the top were a bit more entertaining. PROS: good sized leg holes for babies with a little chub. The leg holes also go down giving baby a more natural walk position. A lot of others we looked at were more of a sitting position which would be awkward to walk with. Cons: hurts when they run into your feet 😋
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Got about a month out of it
customer_reviews.text: Originally had great experience with this walker, but today we noticed the front wheel wasn't turning (it's only about a month of use) and both front wheels no longer spin. I'm not sure if a piece of string is caught up in them or they just aren't designed very sturdy. Can't take apart to see. I will try and find some replacement wheels but probably won't be able to.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice little walker for the price it is kind of ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice little walker for the price it is kind of cheap but it is a good starter for someone just getting something for the grand kid. I did not like the two green things sticking in the sides of the walker. They are dangerous. My grandson kept hitting them and they are very hard so we took them off, Like I said for the price it will get the job done but nothing fancy here.
customer_reviews.author: Lu Lu

customer_reviews.title: Good walker for babies
customer_reviews.text: My mom got this for my daughter to use at her house and my 7 month old really likes it. It is helping her get used to having her feet on the floor, putting weight on them and using her feet to move.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Learner walker
customer_reviews.text: This is the second walker we purchased for one of our grandchildren. The price was very good for the value. The item arrived when promised and in the condition as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really like!
customer_reviews.text: The little girl I bbsit loves it! Only downfall it won’t go over a tiny bump as the wheels are so low to the ground and little. If the wheels were a bit bigger it would be great!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M Baker

customer_reviews.title: Basic walker
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty basic walker, which is to be expected for the price. If you're looking for a no frills walker, this will do the job. My daughter is usually very curious and loves to press buttons on other toys doesn't really seem too interested in the ones on this walker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Mama

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves everything about this walker! It folds down for storage. Came on time. Good price compared to others online and in store. We would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Quated

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust height level
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I don’t like about this walker is the difficulty to change the height level on it. It sucks. Easy for my son to use and he loved it. It wasn’t over bearing like some of the other walkers with tons of toys. I think all the toys is a distraction from the purpose of the walker.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine F.

customer_reviews.title: Great walker
customer_reviews.text: Super cute & great quality. I haven’t cleaned the seat or attempted folding it down but my husband folds it from time to time and says it is easy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Scratched My hardwood Floors
customer_reviews.text: After I purchased the product, it seemed to work very well until i noticed that I had scratches on my hardwood floors! Evidently, the front wheels were not rotating which resulted in the scratches on the floors. I had to stop using this walker and purchase another product. Also, some of the attached toys on the tray had to be removed because they presented a hazard to my baby if she bobbed her head. I would not recommend this product for purchase particularly if you have hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Cherotree

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: This product has saved this mamas life! Baby loves it! She walks and rolls everywhere! I can actually go pee without her crying for me! Has lasted several months of bumps and bangs from an 8 month old. So far so good! We love it! She’s in it at least 3-4 hours a day! Like what??!
customer_reviews.author: kristy Marie

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase !! Only thing...
customer_reviews.text: Very cute !! My daughter loves to lick the flowers (hahaha)... Very good purchase with a good price! Only thing is, I wish the fabric seat would have a little cushioning, maybe a little foam addition on the bottom, that would be perfect!!! & Yes...the baby should never be unattended or ignored in a walker as the doctors don't recommend walker. I put my daughter only when I have nothing to do but looking at her !
customer_reviews.author: forPups

customer_reviews.title: Simple... steardy...design....
customer_reviews.text: Simple... steardy...design.... Been around a month..: daughter uses it for abt 5 mins everyday.... It already is showing signs of wear and tear!! 3 star because the, the spring load to lower and set different height... no longer works... I think that is the only weak link for this product !!
customer_reviews.author: Aby

customer_reviews.title: Rolls well nice size tray
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter has been enjoying this walker. Has a nice large tray and rolls easily. Can’t really say anything bad except maybe folding it up which took a little figuring out but easy after learning it.
customer_reviews.author: Honeybear

customer_reviews.title: Got misled
customer_reviews.text: The product specification suggests that kid's legs should partially stay in air touching just the front part of feet to floor. My girl is 29.5" tall and walker is way too short even at the max height setting. Her legs are bending and not staying as recommended. I don't know how to use it now.The product doesn't specify what max height of kid should be. Disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Vidushi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Seat comes out to wash, only thing was it was hard to get the lever to latch and lock when it came to adjusting the height but once we got the hang of it, it was fine. It’s easily able to maneuver and lightweight to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for our 6M old
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is 6M and was getting bored in the usual jumpers and what not so I bought this, I love it and so does she. My BF put it together very easily and he knows how to change the height and make it flat. Our LO uses it daily so we never get to put it away. Very Very glad we bought on here instead of spending $15 more for one at Target that cannot be made smaller. VERY worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Pollard

customer_reviews.title: This walker hurt my baby within seconds of use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 month old daughter to help give her some independence. I put her in it and within seconds of her getting excited she hit her nose on the hard plastic steering wheel and started crying hysterically. She has a bruise on her nose from this. Do not buy this toy unless you want your babies face full of bruises. The toys on this are all hard plastic. I am sure she is not the first baby to do this either.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous- baby could fall out!
customer_reviews.text: We returned this right away. My daughter is 4.5 months and a bigger girl, but she barely fit in the seat which is dangerous (not bc she was too big). It wasn’t deep enough for any baby and it was way too wide. I could see her leaning over and falling out because it’s too shallow. The plastic seems pretty cheap too. I guess that’s what you get for the price, but we went with another bouncer instead.
customer_reviews.author: michele prokopek

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and overall easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: It’s the perfect height and adjustable. The toys are engaging. There are two little hook things on the side that I am able to hook other toys to it. It rolls and turns easily. Easy to put down and put away or take it with you. The seat comes off easy and can be thrown in the wash 👈.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Landress

customer_reviews.title: cute unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute unit and my granddaughter loves it. I wish it had more toys she gets bored easily. Batteries should come with it because I still haven't put any in for the music to play.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie K.

customer_reviews.title: safe
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his walker. the button to play the music could be a little easier to push for babies. He's 8 months and has a hard time pushing it hard.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hart

customer_reviews.title: Love this Walker
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter has not wanted to get out of this walker since the day we got it. She acts like we don’t have any other toys this house for her play with. It is easy for her to maneuver and she feels like she can be anywhere we are in the house. Good quality nice colors and happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Product came quickly in original boxing. There were four separate pieces and all went together easily and as they should. My daughter loves it so far, and this gives me an opportunity to clean up around the house while she has fun.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: A good, no bells and whistles walker
customer_reviews.text: We like it. No noise or blinking lights and the little guy, just over 9 months old, is quickly getting the hang of it. He has had it about 3 days, and today he was walking fast in it. I think his ability to maneuver will come fast. I think, in spite of some reviews, it is a good thing not to have the rear wheels caster. I have run service carts where that is true, an control is difficult and requires a lot of brute force.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The walker didn't work for my 8 month old grandson. He was able to pull the removable tray off himself. The arch was a perfect handle to grab a hold of. I was disappointed with the toys. The horn was tough for him to push. The steering wheel moves only an inch back and forth. The tiger doesn't slide from one side to the other, moves about an inch if that. Since we returned it, i can't say anything else about it because we returned it.[[ASIN:B00GSX1XEU Bright Starts Walk-A-Bout Walker, Roapming Safari
customer_reviews.author: MzzHalo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Would Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! I was able to put this together by myself and I am not really good at figuring these types of things out. My Son LOVES it and he is moving around. I took the advice of someone who said the "green leaves" were sharp. I do not think hey are sharp, but I just didn't put them on there, because I didn't want to take a chance. You cannot beat it for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Jordans

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I really like that it collapses flat to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I really like that it collapses flat to make storage a lot easier. Only reason it's not 5 stars is because the front wheels aren't as smooth as other baby walkers which makes it harder to turn. The baby einstein one rolls a lot easier but it don't fold down. As my baby grows older and has more control over his movements, it shouldn't be as much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sam K.

customer_reviews.title: Might be better choices out there
customer_reviews.text: It would be better if it had one lower seat adjustment. Also, there should be a way to leave the music and lights on. They only go on for a short period of time and only if you press the button in the steering wheel. It does fold but it’s not flat and with the seat and front toy it doesn't fit under a bed like they show in the pictures. My bed has a fair amount of space underneath and it does not fit even with the toy removed.
customer_reviews.author: Janie M.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Like it! But the wheels r weird, and u have to remove the gray bumpers or she cant move it at all. But, over all.. works
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: ... and saw that his legs were banded but he liked it so much that I decided give it a ...
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking on return this product as soon as place my baby on it and saw that his legs were banded but he liked it so much that I decided give it a try; best choice ever; after a researchi found all similar products are the same high and I started seeing that my baby was actually standing up an using the walker as a support to walk and in a safety manner. So i can tell I can't be happier with this product, give the perfect exercise to the baby that wants to walk but is not ready yet
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Great & easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 month old daughter. She loves it! She can’t quite walk in it yet but of course she will learn over time. Assembly was very easy, didn’t need directions but they come with them. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for baby with short legs
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time finding a walker that would fit my 5 month old properly. He is on the shorter side so we had difficulty finding a walker that allowed his feet to touch the ground - this one works great for him. My only complaint is that the toy on it is rather boring and doesn't attract his interest at all! I attached some of his other toys to the clips on the sides of the walker and he plays with those.
customer_reviews.author: Blademaster103

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but will not withstand the test of time/ durability issues.
customer_reviews.text: Item was easy to assemble and glides well, but you definitely get what you pay for... The walker is not very study due to the plastic material and the seat is also thin due to the lining material. The most upsetting part is the lights/music stopped working within a few months. Not worth it for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: EpicPiggy

customer_reviews.title: ... expensive walker you can buy but it works just fine for our granddaughter to keep at our house
customer_reviews.text: Not the most expensive walker you can buy but it works just fine for our granddaughter to keep at our house.Very satisfied Super cute. My only complaint is that it does not roll real well on carpet but it is perfectly fine for her to sit in and play with the toys. Very cute pink colo.r
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey B

product_meta.title: Bright Starts Roaming Safari Walk-A-Bout Walker
product_meta.description: Who’s the king of the jungle? Your wild one! With this safari baby walker, every tip-toed journey is tip-top adventure. The activity walker is roooooooooaring with toys, sounds, lights and fun. Just what every adventurer needs. The best part? You can remove the toy station and use it on the floor for more playtime. Who doesn’t love a two-for-one! Before your baby can walk on her own (enjoy these moments while you can, mom and dad) an infant walker encourages her growing independence while keeping her safe. Watch as your baby’s imagination turns the whole house into an exotic jungle. Get ready for lions and tigers and tots, oh my!
feature_bullets: Imaginative walker transforms every room into a jungle
Safari-themed walker for boy or girl
Removable toy station can be used almost anywhere
3 height positions grow as your little one does!
Lights, music and toys turn walking into adventure

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,331 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
